column1: [ContextWrapper.getBaseContext() (hyper-link)]:  If you need access to a Context from within another context, you use a ContextWrapper.
That "real" context is what you get by using getBaseContext().
getApplicationContext() - Returns the context for all activities running in application.
getContext() - Returns the context view only current running activity.
[View.getContext() (hyper-link)]:  Returns the context the view is currently running in.  Usually the currently active Activity.
[Activity.getApplicationContext() (hyper-link)]:  Returns the context for the entire application (the process all the Activities are running inside of).
Use this instead of the current Activity context if you need a context tied to the lifecycle of the entire application, not just the current Activity.
